sectionText: 4 hours  Topic: Aeroacoustics.  Physical mechanisms and mathematical modeling of sound generation and flow-sound interaction; An overview of aeroacoustics theories and computational approaches; Advanced turbulence simulation techniques (DNS, LES, unsteady RANS) for evaluation nonlinear sound sources; Accurate numerical methods and boundary conditions for direct computation of sound generation and propagation.  Both engineering biological systems (e.g., the human voice) will be discussed.  Prerequisites:  Intermediate level courses in fluid mechanics and CFD (or numerical methods).
